intro: Linaria supina var. olotensis, commonly known as the prostrate toadflax, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It features slender, creeping stems that grow close to the ground, often forming dense mats. The plant produces small, yellow-orange flowers with two lips, typical of the Scrophulariaceae family. Its leaves are linear and slightly hairy, adapted to thrive in rocky or sandy soils. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas.
